_header: Jesu Christ my leman sweet that diedest on the Rood-Tree
Note: For an adaptation to the Virgin Mary see 3024.
Subjects: Christ, wounds of; prayers, by Christ and His Passion
_description: A prayer of the Five Wounds — one long monorhyming quatrain

BodEngPoeta1.Transcription:
Ihesu Crist my lemmon sweteþat dyȝedest on þe Rode
                    treWiþ al my miht I þe bi secheffor þyne woundes two
                    and þreÞat as depe in to myn herteMot þi loue I stiked
                    beAs was þe spere in to þyn herteWhon þou suffredest
                    deþ for me
BodEngPoeta1.Note:
Appended to 5988;
                    written as eight lines.

BLHar2316.Transcription: Ihesu cryst myn leman sweteȝat for me deyedes on rode treWiht al myn herte i ȝe bisekefor ȝi wudes to and threȜat al so faste in to myn herteȝi loue roted mute beAs was ȝe spere in to ȝi sidewhan ȝow suffredis ded for me
BLHar2316.Editions:
Wright,  Thomas,  and  James Orchard Halliwell-Phillipps, eds.  
             Reliquiae Antiquae.
         2 vols. London: Smith, 1845: 2.119.

            1952: 68.

Sisam,  Celia,  and  Kenneth Sisam, eds.  
             The Oxford Book of Medieval English Verse.
         Oxford: Clarendon, 1970: 234.

BLAdd22283.Transcription:
Ihesu crist me lemmon sweteÞat diȝedest on þe Rode
                    treWith al my miȝt I þe bisecheffor þyne woundes two
                    and þreÞat is deope In to myn herteMot þi loue I stiked
                    beAs was þe spere In to þin herteWhon þou suffredest
                    deþ for me Amen
BLAdd22283.Facsimiles:
Digital Facsimile of British Library MS Add. 22283 (‘Simeon’).
         2014; http://www.bl.uk/manuscripts/FullDisplay.aspx?ref=Add_MS_22283.

Lam559.Transcription:
Ihesu criste mi lord swetethat deidist on the rode trewith all
                    mi hert I the bisechefor thi wundes two or threthat also fast in hert
                    mynmote thi loue stykid beso was the scharpe sperewhen thou
                    suffirdist deth for me
